content.detailedDescription: I was driving home on the highway when i came over a small hill and this is when i saw this. this was low enough i just happened to see this looking through the windshield. when i first glanced, i thought it was a plane, but i know better, i worked at an airport years ago, i've never seen an orange, golden yellow, glowing airplane, sitting in the sky. this was not very high in the air, it was not low, but too low to be an aircraft. it did not move, it just emitted a very bright glow. it was just bright and big. i was just stunned and thought it was strange. i also questioned is it a tower? all of the towers in our area blink red. this was much bigger than a tower light and it just glowed. when i looked up again it was gone. i only looked away for maybe one or two seconds. this was a solid glowing ball. that was last night. my husband, who gets off work at 10:00p called me on his way home tonight and told me he saw a big orangish yellow ball in the sky. he was driving south coming home and saw this thing. when he got home we drove all around town looking up to see if we could see this again, but we didn't. i have no idea what this was, and neither does he , but i think it is strange that we both saw this. i would like to know if anybody else saw this too. we live in a small town so maybe i'll find out.
content.summary: Large fireball/globe

content.detailedDescription:
From my hot tub on the east side of my home, i noticed a very bright light, similar to a satellite moving slowly from what would have been the southwest to the northeast.  because of where my hot tub sits in relation to my house, i did not notice the item until it was almost directly overhead.

it had no flashing lights like an aircraft and appeared to be too low for a satellite and too high for most conventional aircraft - also too bright.  this is also a highly unusual path for aircraft traffic.  it may have slowed, hesitated or varied slightly in it's course, but i can not be sure.

initially, i thought this may be the shuttle or iss catching the glint of the sun that had just set over the horizon, but the shining was far brighter than previous sightings of known space objects and the light did not fade or dissipate as it went towards the visible edge of the sky (we have mountains fairly close there).

i had to exit the hot tub and proceed to the front of my home to maintain visibility as my neighbors home and shed quickly blocked my view. i lost sight of the item as it went past the rim of the mountains.
content.summary: Bright moving light, no flashing from sw to ne

content.detailedDescription: Object moving northeast from southwest. bright white light no blinking. too low and too bright to be satellite. moving in wrong direction to be satellite from this area. my wife also nwitnessed object and called me from 15 miles away. object moved a bit slower than an aircraft, and in a direction aircraft do not normally follow in this area.
content.summary: Bright light no blinking lights

content.detailedDescription:
On the fourth of july i took a lot of photographs int the painted hills of the john day fossil beds in central oregon. i reviewed the digital camera files when i got home the next day and found an unusual elliptical shape near the top of one photo. i enlarged it and enhanced it as much as i could with photo shop and photo paint, but it remains unclear. the enhancement did bring out distinct concentric ellipses, an inner one surrounded by an outer one. when changing the image to a negative view it became a little more visible. the photo was taken through the moon roof of my car at 6:53:16 am., the sky was clear and there were no signs of aircraft there. i didn't see the ufo because i held the camera above my head and clicked the shutter a couple of times. today, i checked another photo that was taken at 6:58:02 am and found an image higher in altitude. it is very small and obscure, but has the same basic features as the one found in the other photo.

i wanted to have those images in the the photos checked out by someone with a background in ufo photo analysis.
content.summary: Ufo image appears on two digital photos taken in a remote part of oregon

content.detailedDescription:
I am going to simply cut and paste my description of the event from a forum where i have already posted about this event.  i really don't feel like having to re-type everything word for word.  if you need additional information or clarification, please contact me directly.

paste:

posted on 07/07/09 @ ~9:30am on topix.Com (bartlett, il forum):

"did anyone else notice the strange lights over bartlett at night on july 4th? our group had set up camp for the fireworks display in the big, grassy clearing across the street from the carnival. while waiting for the show to begin, i looked up in the western sky and saw an odd glowing orange-red light. it was quite bright and very high in the sky. at first, i didn't think anything of and just assumed it was one of the many planes coming in for a landing at o'hare. 

a few minutes later i looked back up in the sky and saw that the same ball of light was still there and hadn't seemed to move at all. i thought this was very odd. i pointed the light out to everyone else in my group and we all watched it for several minutes trying to figure out what it was.

there were no blinking/flashing lights coming from the ball of light that would indicate it was some type of aircraft. it didn't make any noise. for several minutes, it didn't move at all. then after about 5-10 minutes, the light started to move very, very slowly to the north. eventually, the light moved behind some trees and we could no longer see it. the fireworks started a few minutes later (or maybe they had already started, i can't remember). i turned my attention to the fireworks and forgot about the light.

after the fireworks display, we pack up and started walking south on the bartlett nature trail to get back to our friends' house where we had parked our car. as we were walking along, i looked up in the sky and saw the same glowing light again. it appeared to be back in the original position it had been when i first saw it. this time it wasn't moving at all. it remained stationery. it just hung there in the sky faintly dimming in and out. i pointed it out to everyone again, and we all were very perplexed as to what this light could be. of course, the jokes started up about ufos and independence day.

we kept walking along the trail and at one point passed a clearing in the trees to the west so that we were able to get a good view of the distant western horizon. at that point, we saw 3-4 more of the very same glowing lights way out in the distance. at first, they appeared to be arranged in an arch formation. then the distant lights started moving up into the sky and formed a perfectly straight line pointing from the ground to the sky at about a 45 degree angle and angled towards the south. the distant lights remained in the formation for the rest of our walk back to our cars.

about 10 minutes after re-spotting the original light in the sky that was closer to us, it slowing dimmed and finally went black as if it were a light bulb that had just burnt out.

did anyone else notice any of this?"


posted on 07/07/09 @ ~4:30pm on topix.Com (bartlett, il forum):

"nope, hadn't been drinking yet. i've got at least seven other people from my group that saw the same thing. i'm not trying to claim i saw a ufo. i was simply asking if anyone else noticed this and, if so, do they know what it was. my description of the events was lengthy because i tend to be anal and ocd about describing anything. also, i was hoping that the detailed description might possibly spark an idea in someone else's mind and they would be like, "ah ha! based on your description, what you saw is most likely such-and-such."


posted on 07/07/09 @ ~11:20pm on topix.Com (bartlett, il forum):

"sweet! someone else who saw the same thing we did, and you had 30 in your group! like i said, i'm not trying to start some kind of ufo conspiracy. i would just like to find out what i saw. if there is a reasonable, terrestrial explanation, i would be happy with that. however, there is nothing in my mind and experience that i could compare these lights to and think, "oh, that's what that was." and i don't mean to sound like these were some sort of bright, intense, other-worldly lights that made your jaw drop and exclame, "we are not alone!" these were just odd lights in the sky that didn't fit in with the rest of the lights in the sky that i would expect to see in everyday normal life. they behaved oddly, and i cannot logically equate what i saw with anything that i have seen before.

normally, if i were to see lights in the sky, especially if there were numerous ones in a formation, i would just assume they were planes lining up for landing at o'hare (given that i live in a reasonable proximty to the o'hare airport area). however, the lights from planes have a tendency to move in the sky as they descend and approach the runway. also, planes (and other aircraft) have blinking lights.

the lights i saw in the sky were fairly stationary or moved very, very slowly. there were no corresponding blinking lights associated with the orangeish balls that would indicate they were aircraft. after about 10-15 minutes, the light would slowly dim out and disappear.

as i am currently typing this, my wife is on her pc searching for these same type of observations. apparently, there have been a ton of these sightings within the il, mi, in, wi area over this past weekend. i need to look into this more and see what other people are reporting. my wife is looking at reports at www.Mufon.Com .

i really wish that the forums on topix.Com had a wider readership so that i could get responses from more people."
content.summary: Orange-red glowing mars-like ball high in the sky faintly dimming in and out

content.detailedDescription: In the backyard playing volleyball and notice this floating orb which appeared to be on fire.  time to fetch binoculars and it would not come into focus.  we thought it was a piece of burning firework at first but it would not go out and continued on a consistent path (3 mins or so) across the sky.  low cloud cover but it was hard to determine distance.  no sound and in perfect line so if it was a luminary from a firework it would have been blowing all over as the winds were 10-15mph.  the orb finally disappeared into the cloud cover.   this happened again hour later same path.  next sighting was around 2:30 am july 5th.  much faster and farther off in the distance but the object would stop on a dime and then take off.  it made the same orbit twice before stopping around 2:45 am july 5th.  no sound.  we had four people witness the event and others in town saw the same 9:15 cdt sighting.  we were all in disbelief of what we saw so we really haven't discussed until after the fact.  we had no explanation as we all argued as if it was a plane, firework, mars (planets don't do this), etc...But nobody really knew what to say.
content.summary: Flashing orange orb's

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were watching the space station going across the sky when a smaller light appearing to be in the same orbit appeared approximately 10 seconds behind the space station. the smaller light suddenly disappeared when it was just below the big dipper. as we live on a hill we were able to watch the space station as it disappeared in the horizon. the smaller light did not reappear.
we often observe satellites from this location.
the sky was clear with only wispy clouds that didn't interfer with our observation.
was this another satellite trailing the space station? we've never seen this one before, or a satellite to just suddenly disappear in the dark of night.
content.summary: Light behind space station while observing

content.detailedDescription:
It was after the fireworks had stopped for the night at our house in lynnwood, wa. my boyfriend and i were outside on the back deck when we saw a bright red light coming up on the horizon (ne). it was moving as fast as a satellite/airplane would accross the sky. the light was very easy to see and bright, but there was no definite outline to it. it was a circular shape, but the light almost looked like a laser would with blurred edges. the center of the red light was bright yellow/orange and looked exactly like a star except was a bit larger and closer, definately in the atmosphere. as it slowly moved accross the sky and over our house, my boyfriend was running to get his cell phone so we could take a picture when we saw a second, orange, light coming from the same place the first did. the light flew from the ne direction se, and they both followed the same path and faded away into the night.

these were moving too quickly to be anything but a powered object, and were moving in a definate direction at a constant speed.
content.summary: Red and orange flying objects, speed of satellite, distance and size of an airplane.

content.detailedDescription: I was on the beach in union pier, michigan, to watch the fireworks and i noticed what looked like a plane. i pointed out that it would be neat to see the fireworks from an airplane, and my family and i watched it as we talked about this. as it got closer to us, we realized that it was not a plane. it was a bright red light and it stopped almost directly in front of us and stayed still for a few minutes. we watched it and noticed that it was slightly pulsating and eminating a blue-ish light amidst the red glow. then it started to get smaller and smaller and it simply faded into the darkness, as if it was moving further up into the atmosphere. not more than a minute or two later, i looked to the east again and saw another one heading our way, moving in a very straight pattern and rather fast, just like the first did. it was not floating, as it seemed to be going too fast and too accurately straight, and there was no noise or visible propellers, engines, or wings. it was just a glowing ball. sure enough, this one did exactly what the first did in the exact same spot. as soon as it disappeared, another followed and still another. i was able to capture the second one on my digital camera, but i ran out of memory to capture the 3rd and 4th.
content.summary: Noticed a bright red glowing object moving from the east. it stopped in front of us and stayed still for about 2 minutes. then it seemed to get smaller until it disappeared from the spot it was. 3 more of the exact same thing followed.

content.detailedDescription:
enjoying a cool summer night on the 4th of july in tortugas, nm (near las cruces) turned into an exciting night for a group of family and friends.  
  as we were relaxing after a long afternoon of hanging out with family and friends, i decided to get up from my chair to stretch out when a bright red light in the southern sky caught my attention.  i thought it was an airplane at first glanze, but it looked much brighter than the usual airplane or helicopter light.  i stayed focus on the light until it slowly started dimming.  i continued looking in the same direction and started seeing a round object appear in the distance and heading directly overhead.  i called for my friend quickly to see the object that was passing over us.  he quickly looked into the sky and mentioned that it looked like a balloon.  the object did look like a balloon as it was passing directly over us but going at the speed of fast airplane.  the object was right over the cloud level as it disappeared behind some clouds directly over the city of las cruces. 
  the object was oval in shape and appeared to be of grey/silver color against the dark sky.  no lights seeing on the object as it passed overhead.  the object was heading from south to north from the el paso, tx area to the las cruces, nm area. the speed it was traveling was a bit faster than a normal airplane would fly.  no sounds emitted from the object.  it would also appear that the bright red light was on top of the object and became obstructed by the oval object as it passed directly over us.  others to experience the event were my good friend, my father-in-law and my niece.
  this is my first experience of anything of this nature.  i must say it was not scary, but rather a very exciting experience.   it would be nice to see if others saw anything similar flying over the las cruces area in new mexico on the 4th of july of 2009.
content.summary: Amazing experience in new mexico on the 4th of july!

content.detailedDescription:
hola que tal, escribo a este medio ya que es el unico a la mano que tengo para poder relatar lo que acabo de ver hace unos minutos.

 somos una familia que vivimos en una colonia llamada lazaro cardenas en comalcalco tabasco mexico, mi hermana cinthya, fue la primera en ver el ovni en el cielo alrededor de las 20:36, ella logro ver una luz en el cielo cuando acababa de regresar de la tienda de comprar unas cosas y le llamo la atencion una luz muy brillante justo encima de nuestra casa, era del tama���o de 4 veces el de un lucero. entonces al poco rato comenzo a gritar ya que aquella luz comenzo a moverse siguiendo una linea recta, todos corrimos y salimos para ver que habia pasado y hasta los vecinos salieron a ver, eramos 5 personas quienes presenciamos el ovni.

descripcion del ovni: una luz brillante (4 veces mas grande que un lucero) la luz era fija e intensa, no parpadeaba, tenia forma circular, y se movia en linea recta.

estamos 100% seguros que no era un avion ya que estos no pueden detenerse en el aire y continuar su camino ni tampoco un helicoptero por que no tenia mucha luces y no eran intermitentes, era una sola luz fija, color blanco, como un foco iluminandonos,ademas un avion paso a los pocos minutos despues de haber visto el ovni y claramente notamos la diferencia, un avion tiene luces intermitentes color rojo y blanco y ademas el resplandor era muy apagado.

lo que vimos no era ni avion ni helicoptero, era simplemente un ovni y la verdad que la piel se nos puso de gallina.

espero y alguien mas halla presenciado este evento y pueda compartir un testimonio mas de lo que vimos hoy a las 20:36 hrs.

atte. roberto (comalcalco tabasco mexico)
content.summary: Un ovni visto en el cielo hoy 07/07/09 a las 8:36 pm.

content.detailedDescription:
On the evening of july 4, 2009, my fianc��� and i took our children to a carnival in lancaster (near buffalo), new york.  as it started to get dark, we positioned ourselves on a patch grass on the corner of broadway and a small side street called "pac way", so we could watch fireworks.  we were facing cayuga creek toward aurora street.

our youngest son needed to use the bathroom, so my fianc��� left with him to go to the port-a-potties.  while they were gone, at approximately 10:00 p.M., a glittery, white firework shot up into the air to the left of the town's water tower, turning my attention to the west.  i then noticed a fiery, orange globe rising slowly over the creek to the immediate left of the white firework.  i expected the globe to explode into thousands of sparklers, but as the real fireworks display got under way a full 90��� to my right, i realized this fiery globe was not a firework at all.

the globe rose gently, floating overhead, gradually ascending and moving at a steady pace to the southeast.  my fianc��� returned with our son, and i pointed out the globe to him, which he had also noticed while waiting in line for the bathroom.

i had my 35mm camera with me, and my fianc��� asked me to take a picture of the object.  but my camera (set to auto focus) struggled to find a focal point in the night sky and would not take the picture.  the globe kept ascending and moving farther away until it was no longer visible.

i was disappointed, but then we noticed a second fireball rising from the same point of origin as the first, behind the creek.  and this time, i was able to capture a photograph with my camera on manual focus.

the second globe behaved the same as the first, following the same southeasterly course and gradually getting higher and farther away in the sky to the point of no longer being visible.

several spectators who had gathered to watch fireworks were distracted by the globes in the sky, all shouting out speculations as to what the objects could logically be.  the consensus seemed to be that they were hot air balloons.  i personally find it peculiar (not to mention extremely dangerous) to set off on a hot air balloon joy ride at 10:00 p.M. in such close proximity of a fireworks display.  the globes were totally self-contained with nothing attached, hanging or dangling from them, and they ascended to such heights they were no longer visible - clearly higher than hot air balloons would be capable of traveling.

while the center of the globes appeared bright orange-red and flickering as if on fire, i am doubtful the globes were any type of flare, as a flare would eventually fall downward.  these objects continued to rise higher and higher, drifting off into the night sky.  they also did not burn up but maintained their size and perfectly circular shape.

after the globes disappeared, we turned our attention back to the fireworks, and, when they were done, packed up for home.  we thought we had witnessed a rather odd - but innocuous - event until we noticed several reports of similar experiences cropping up on the internet.  we, therefore, felt we should share our own 4th of july / fire globe event as well.
content.summary: Two orange, fiery globes near fireworks.

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside smoking a cigarette, looking up as i usually do, skywatching.  it was still blue skies outside in gibsonville, north carolina, and there wasn't a single star in the sky - i looked hard, too.  the sunset was scheduled tonight for 8:38pm, and it was now shortly after 8:50pm.

i watched a car pass by, and when i looked back up, i saw this bright object, as bright as jupiter, directly above my head, at 12 o'clock.  it wasn't moving, as i had stationary power lines right above me to determine movement.  i watched it get slightly brighter, and after watching it for about 5 minutes, my neck started to hurt from looking straight up.  i looked down to stretch my neck for a second, and then looked back up, only to notice that the star-like object is starting to slowly fade away.  as it fades, i see another "dot" appear right beside it - it looked like a millimeter away from my point of view.  then both objects stopped fading, and another dot appeared right beside the second one, and finally, a third object appeared right beside that one!  they were in the shape a single parenthesis ")"...  once they seemed to make that shape, two of them (the second and fourth one) faded away, leaving 2 left (the first and third one).  then those last 2 faded away together, until i could just barely see a faint "smudge" of white in the sky.  they then faded completely out of view, and i watched for five more minutes, only for nothing to return.  ...The whole event last for approximately 5 minutes.

by the way, i saw just about the exact same thing a year ago, where it started as one bright "star", straight up, while the sky was still blue.  then as it faded, more "stars" appeared directly beside it, forming the shape of "(".  then they all slowly faded away at about the same moment.  again, no movement at all - just what seemed to be at a very high altitude directly above my head.  this was also at about the same time of day last year, too.

anyway, i'm just happy to see yet another "ufo" sighting!
content.summary: Bright object remained in one spot, then faded away as 3 more "dots" appeared right beside it, in the shape of ")"

content.detailedDescription: It was about 21:45 pm, i was watching the soccer game of santos futebol clube x csa on my television, the first game of brazilian cup. so, when it finished, about 23:50 pm, i went to my yard, just to think, i always do this. so, in this moment, i started to look the moon, it was a nice and beautiful full moon night by the way. in the first moment, i've saw something very very weird, and didn't believed that... i've rubbed my eyes, and it was there, a great sized ufo, over my yard, many feets above, of course. at the first time, i thought it was my mind, but, when i've rubbed the eyes, i've saw that again. i was shocked and stunned, just watching that ufo flying through the skies above my yard. it was amazing, the ufo wasn't noisy, it didn't made any noise! and it was fast, not so fast, but fast. anyway, the object wasn't round, it was like a semi-circle, splitted in two, with something like a cabin interconnected with something like wings, the object was gray-colored and with red lights in the probably "wings". the sighting leasted between one and three minutes aprox... at the moment, my feelings were: surprise, shock, happiness and a bit scary at all, i never saw something like that, it was amazing. during the sighting, i was stunned, and after it just gone by the skies, i was excited: ran to my house and told to a couple friends what happened. well, is it. sorry for the english, i'm brazilian and don't know the english language very well.
content.summary: Wasn't round at all, weird shape, gray colored with red lights.

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside of my house with my digital camera and got this footage when i aimed the camera up at the sky. 
the ufo movement was extremely fast and high in the sky so i used slow motion in this clip so it could be observed.
content.summary: Slow motion view of ufo activity flying very rapid and high in sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Me and my friend shannon were driving home from visiting with friends in bridgeport, we left around 1am and headed to my home. after we crossed the 75 to 23 south exchange we began to see what looked like a large plane it appeared to not be moving in any direction. at first all we could see were two very bright lights that were too low to the ground and seemed to large for a plane. the closer we got the more uncomfortable i became,( i do not include how shannon felt as her reaction was and continued to be before during and after, "i'm ok really," with white knuckles on the steering wheel.) we passed hill road and lost track of the object due  to a land fill. as we came around the other side of it we could see it again, it still remain motionless as our direction once again was true south. 
shannon said that she felt it could be a tower,but as we got closer that was discarded as we could clearly see it was some kind of air craft. the closer we got the more lights we could see on it, at least 15 blinking in red white yellow and some times blue. as we drew even closer it became clear it was very very large, we both got the feeling it was as large as a  747, and when we drove under it, we could see it had no wings and was completely stationary. that's when we could see the rest of the lights, there were another 5 very large very bright lights, i am not sure if they were under or on the leading edge, maybe both. what was clear was that it was low enough to the ground that i could see the underside lit up by the lights on the back of it as we passed under and away from it. once we were maybe a mile away from where we had drove under it, we could no longer see it. i was very uncomfortable, and even commented to shannon that i wish i had anxiety medication. i felt scared and kept looking all around us as we drove on till we exited 23 at m-59 and headed west to my home in howell. unable to sleep i stayed awake till 6am and it is now 6:30pm, my chest hurts and the headache that started after the sighting is still with me.
content.summary: Long oval with 25 lights.

content.detailedDescription:
Since june 2009 i have been regularly skywatching at night. i have been seeing white star-like orb ufo's. these orbs can dim or get very bright. they are low in the atmosphere and appear at various times of the night and in many different positions in the sky. they speed up and slow down and make sharp maneuvers at times. i usually see one at a time so i do not know if there is more than one or if the same one is appearing over and over in the sky cruising along. i have been wanting to get one on film getting brighter but have not had that opportunity until on this night. at approx 10:45pm est after i had just filmed the orb passing by some stars i sat back down and continued to skywatch. i was scanning the sky with my eyes and looked above me to catch a glimpse of a very bright, low, star-like object maybe a few hundred feet passing over where i was sitting. it was very low and very bright. it was moving west to east. i jumped out of my chair and began to film it. i was so astonished at the complete silence of this slow moving object! i could not see if it was a structured craft or what it was at all. all i could see was the bright light. you can see how low and bright this object was when it passes the stars as it is moving across the sky. i am an avid skywatcher and have been involved with this ufo phenomenon my whole life. i have filmed airplanes, helicopters and satellites and other various explainable aircraft. this was none of those things! the complete silence and appearance of this ufo light was amazing and i am so very grateful i was able to document it! i have the other ufo orb footage from various days in june and july i will upload after this one as well as what i filmed directly before this awesome sighting. note: my camcorder was running behind an hour. here is the youtube video:

http://www.Youtube.Com/watch?V=adud2jqp6rw
content.summary: Silent bright sphere object moving west to east july 7, 2009, ohio.

content.detailedDescription: I probably would not have looked up if not for the sound of two military jets.  they where circling around the area to the north east.  this is not seen around here too often as there are no major airports for 60 miles or so.  they looked like f-15s, but i don't think they fly those any more.  they were definitely military jets one seen very clearly, and the other jet was heard.  there are not any bases close by.  while i was looking up to see the jets something else caught my eye.  there where maybe a dozen or so objects to the east - south east possibly over juneau, wi area.  the best way to describe them is to liken them to a school of fish.  they where going in a large circle moving fast and in sync like a school of fish.  i lost them once and went to get my wife to see them.  while looking up to see them again, i reacquired the strange lights due east from my position. the lights seemed to be very bright -9 magnitude and then change to very dark all while going in a complete circle. the circle seamed to be horizontal (side to side) and not vertical (up and down). at times seen above the clouds and at times seen below.  the objects where moving quite fast in a clock wise circle.  the second sighting did not last very long and my wife was not able to see the objects. it seamed that the objects disappeared and less than a minute or two later a jet was again heard at a very fast rate, and you can clearly tell the difference between military and civilian jets.  the cloud layer was very thin higher altitude clouds.  i would guess the clouds at the time to be 6000 to 10000 ft.  at least one military jet was heard again, but not see after the last ufo sighting.  sounded very fast, but not super sonic.  possibly super sonic at high altitude when jet was last spotted heading straight east toward lake michigan.  i would very much like to find out what these objects where, and where the jets involved at all, or was it all just coincidence.
content.summary: Looked like a school of fish, but way up in the sky.  there where alto-stratus clouds that the objects where moving above and below.  the keep going in a circle over and over slowly going east.  i would loose them and pick up the objects 30 degrees away.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on the deck in the backyard watching the skies when i noticed a bright white star like object much brighter than the star vega. it was moving silently from the sw to the ne and it had no other lights on it as would be normal for jets.  it did not blink as it moved slowly across the sky.  i thought it could have been a satellite but it was much too bright.  it was however trailed by a much dimmer object which did appear to be a satellite.  they moved together about a hands width apart at arms length.  i watched it until it dissappeared over the horizon.  total sighting lasted approx. 3 minutes.
content.summary: Brilliant white sphere moving sw to ne, followed by much dimmer object.

content.detailedDescription:
My name is bob jefferds,

my wife and i took our 2 dogs outside for their final potty for the day. this was approximately 9pm.  it was an extremely clear night with very intense moon.  i was admiring the clear evening sky with the bright moon when i noticed a bright sphere of light coming from the south west tracking to the north east.  i could not determine it's elevation. my best estimate is that of an aircraft. if i had to put a number to the elevation my best guess would be between 10,000 and 20,000 feet.  at first i thought it was an aircraft, however, as it continued to move toward my position i could not see the typical red or green wing tip lights.  i continued to observe and looked to see if there was a beacon which there wasn't.  the sphere of light was unusually brilliant.  as it began to pass i thought perhaps it was landing lights on an aircraft and as it passed maybe the beam of the landing lights would pass me. it didn't.  it remained bright and steady. the sphere of light continued north east until i lost sight of it. its path was linear and steady.  i couldn't hear any type of engine noise. i have worked around aircraft and this incident was not ordinary.
content.summary: Sphere of bright white light moving from sw to ne.

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 9pm i was on the patio with 2 friends looking out over todos santos bay.  one friend called may attention to a bright object at about 45 degrees above the horizon and asked if it was a plane.  the object was extremely bright and, best guess, about 6 or 7 times the size of venus and moving rapidly  from west to east.   i used binoculars but it was moving too fast to see more than a brilliant light.   my first thought was that it was the space station crossing over again.  i had missed the first passing over ensenada but it looked the way friends described it to me.  just after passing overhead, another object, small and dim but moving just as fast, appeared from the north and abruptly changed direction to follow the larger one.  another small, dim object flew passed the other 2, coming out of the east.  this one came to a dead stop when it reached overhead.  it began to grow brighter until it was as big and bright as the first object and then dimmed again and reversed it's direction to go east with the other 2 objects.  we followed their path until it crossed behind the hills.

the first and larger of the objects moved in a straight line and my logical mind told me that it might have been a satellite or the space station but never in my life have i seen any object move the way the other 2 did.  i was totally stunned.
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 3 objects crossed the sky from west to east.

content.detailedDescription: My family was in lewiston (by gaylord) michigan on tee lake to celebrate the 4th of july holiday.  we had just finished watching a 4th of july fireworks display from our property on the lake, and retreated to the campfire.  some time after being by the fire, my father pointed out a bright orange fire ball object in the sky, much brighter than a star/sattlelite, and it was moving fairly fast across the sky to the right (from my view). i picked up the binoculars and tried to get a better look, but there was no detail of the object through the binoculars.  it was an orange glow.  it seemed to stop and hover over the moon for about 1 minute before disapearing.  it was as if the object made a left at the moon and hightailed it away from earth. we all agreed that it was not a blinking light, but a constant light.  it was too bright and round for a plane, it was to bright and fast for a satalite, and anyting in our orbit would not stop in mid flight and disapear.
content.summary: Orange fire ball moving to the right (from my view) towards the moon faster than an air plane, hovered over moon for a few minutes, disapeared.

content.detailedDescription: Bright object ,silent,moving s/w to n/e at around 10,000 ft.Watched it go under passenger jet then trees blocked view.Was able to view it with binoculars for about a min.Very bright round object.Faa should have got it with radar,due to passenger jet at high altitude as it passed under it at half the distance to aircraft.
content.summary: Bright object, silent, moving s/w to n/e at around 10,000 ft.

content.detailedDescription:
family owns a small island on semi wilderness lake in ontario, canada.
while on vacation 6/16 niece (amy) awoke early to walk around the island and take pictures.  she took a picture of the lake because it was so calm and a bit misty.  when looking at this photo afterwards she noticed a bright object leaving the lake and headed skyward.  she did not notice anything prior to this, nor did she see the object with the naked eye.  looking at the object thru the camera, and blowing it up, it appears to be rod shaped, brightly lit with colored bands around the top, a rounded gold tip, and what appears to be a possible "vapor" trail behind it.  she was alone at the time.  there were no people or boats on the lake.  the photo was taken in a northeasternly direction with a cannon powershot set on auto.  the area behind is heavily wooded.
when the rest of the family awoke amy showed them the picture.  they were all puzzled by it but basically blew it off.  after being shown the picture myself i felt it was worth pursuing as it appeared to be more than just a light anomaly.
content.summary: Lighted rod shaped object photographed coming out of lake.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were watching the space station fly overhead. what looked like a satilite come into view coming from the north. as it approached within two finger tips held at arms length it flared from pin prick size to about the size of venus. within a few seconds it returned to original size and continued south, disappearing behind a tree. after it was gone we saw another pin prick of light moving behind and in the same direction as the space station but way behind it. this went on for about two more minutes after the initial eventi have been watching the night sky for over 50 years but have never seenanything like this.
content.summary: Satellite in area of space station flared from pin prick to size of venus then when back to pin prick size.

content.detailedDescription: I was watching fireworks at a friend's home in dallas, pennsylvania and looked up into the sky. i observed a red/orange round object, that i though was a firework. as i was waiting for the "firework" to go off, it didn't. it continued to travel across the sky, slowly, in a straight line, moving southwest directionally. everyone else at this fouth of july party observed the object as well (about 10 people) and no one could identify it. no one even had a guess. i was awestruck. i couldn't believe what i was seeing. everyone else felt the same way. no one really knew how to react. eventually the object continued in a southwest direction until it was out of sight. it did not disappear behind a cloud or change direction; it simply just continued its flight out of sight. a few minutes later another person at the party stated he saw a satelite traveling in the same direction that disappeared behind a cloud, but i did not see this. before i could get a camera the object was gone.
content.summary: Reddish/orange circular object traveled across the sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside of my house with my girlfriend,2 year old daughter,4 year old daughter,7 year old step daughter watching the fire crackers behind my house,looking over my roof when i noticed an orange glow coming from the west.Then it was moving horizontally so i said to myself this cant be a firework.The object was moving real slow approx.30 miles an hour if that.My nieghbor to the back of me set off a big firework,the object kind of dipped a little and thats when it changed direction what looked like a 45 degree angle towards the sky still going east.I watched it until i couldnt see it anymore.My neighbors kids across the street saw it also,i think they are around ten years old,i dont know.My girlfriends nephew said he saw that same object one town over.I asked him to describe it and it was identical to what i saw,he's sixteen.The object was oval in shape,orange in color and was probably moving slower than 30 miles an hour.I was more excited than afraid because this is the second time i saw something i couldnt explain in the sky.The first time was in 2002 in san diego.I was on a night job with my manager ricardo.He yelled what the hell is that,i turned around and saw what looked like a horizontal smoke bomb.It was over the pacific ocean not to far out and it to was only a few hundred feet up.When you lite a smoke bomb  the smoke goes vertical,this looked like a smoke bomb on its side.It was moving south then turned west towards the ocean.When it did the "smoke trail" followed.It was purple and orange and even though it was eleven thirty at night i could see it well.It seemed to be glowing also.I saw it with ricardo but im not going to give his last name out of respect.So for both sightings i had people witness it with me.
content.summary: Orange, oval thing coasting approx. 300 to 500 feet.

content.detailedDescription:
I'm writing this with a bit of caution. as a trained scientist and an applicant to several phd programs my reputation may be at stake. 
during a vacation i visited the rainforest that surrounds lake carite of puerto rico i awoke in the middle of the night from restlessness. i wandered around the forest as i always did. but after wandering for a bit started to notice a strange metallic vapor smell.

 i recognized the smell from  my freshman year in college when we were turning silver metal into a vapor compound. very similar, but with something indistinguishable mixed in. i followed the smell and stumbled upon an area full of tall grasses and ferns. in the middle of this was a large black almost diamond shaped object. it was faceted on top like a diamond and rounded off at the bottom. it touched the ground on its rounded end and somehow managed to stay upright. i got closer in an attempt to find an opening but i found none, it was almost like a solid black stone in the ground. i attempted to use a stone to scratch off a sample of the material and a small chip came off. the material peeled away from the object almost like obsidian. i ran to the house to get my camera and returned as quickly as i could. 

when i returned the object was in the air almost indistinguishable from the surrounding sky, the colors mingled perfectly to camouflage it. i attempted pictures but they were pointless. the object was too dark in colour, the light too low. as it rose however, i did notice and almost honey colored row of circles appear on the faceted top. they seemed to be lit almost like a tungsten bulb behind paper. they seemed to move independently from the object and circled the faceted top. 

to make things even stranger the hole in the ground the rounded edge of the object had made was covered in plants by morning. it's as if overnight the forest had sprung up to repair the damage. i cleared them away and try as i might i could not find the hole left behind. the only thing i found was an abundance of plants and insects in unusual numbers near the area.The only evidence i found was a 1mm-ish burn on a nearby rock with the impression of the small shard that i had managed to chip with a rock.

now i don't know if i'm going mad and this was all a dream or something. but it feels good i suppose to get this all off my chest. as a scientist in training i have no explanation, there is obviously no rational explanation for anything that happened during these night. maybe someone will have a similar story and this will be of use, maybe not.
content.summary: Saw strange flying object in tropical rainforest.

content.detailedDescription: First object appeared as a bright start moving south to north.  the object turned and it's intrinsic brightness increased to equal that of venus.  the object continued north and again turned.  it began to dim until it disappeared from sight.  a second object appeared from behind a tree.  the second object was equally as bright as the first.  it continued north until is disappeared over the horizon.  the second object was followed by a third and much dimmer companion.
content.summary: Three star like objects moving in unison.

content.detailedDescription: My family and i were coming home from eating out. it was about 10:30 pm. we reached the entrance to our subdivision and my granddaughter said "what's that?". we looked up and saw the objects. we pulled over and got out. there were at least 12 orange, round objects in the sky. it was overcast but with breaks in the sky. they could be seen very clearly. they were in a "big dipper" formation. they were too high up to be fireworks. too close together to be planes and could not be confused with helicopters either. they were slowly crossing the sky. then, 2-3 disappeared at a time. until there was only one and then it disappeared. it was very exciting to see. there were other people out watching them also.
content.summary: Round orange.
